alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Kanawha; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kanawha, east central Putnam and southeastern Jackson Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 458 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Poca, or near Nitro, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Sissonville, Cross Lanes, Pinch, Institute, Elkview and Liberty. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 100 and 122. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 47 and 57. Route 119 between mile markers 78 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
